reviews.text:
I'm a big fan of rail travel, though the prices these days are absurd. But this is a review of the Stirling Train Station, not the train network. Anyway, there's a decent cafe here, the ticket office seemed - to me at least - like a friendly place if you need to buy a ticket, and the ticket machines themselves work well - I never saw one that didn't work.

But most importantly for people like me, this is a station that still carries some of the romance of the old train network. It's kept clean and looks well-supervised by the station staff, but above all else it retains the charm and attractiveness of the stations of my youth and of my nostalgic dreams.
Beautiful old station, but there was nowhere to get coffee or snacks while I was waiting to change trains here.
I loved Sterling, was beautiful day town and Castle amazing!

I was paying for a ticket using cash, And the woman was saying I needed to pay extra because she didn't believe I was 15, When I clearly looked young. She then made my friend feel anxious when she was saying "I don't want to except all this cash" and my friend didn't have anymore money than that. Overall the staff at the ticket desk is rude and made us feel very anxious about going to the ticket desk again.

Upon missing my train one of your staff, an older Gray hair/ balding man with a moustache after asking me if i'd missed it was unbelievably rude to me in front of several customers. This was not having a laugh or friendly banter this was utter cheek that left me feeling offended and not like I can safely come back without being humiliated in public by your staff.
